alert.note: Alert for Southern Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 21 at 7:31PM MST until February 22 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 11 PM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing and drifting snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 2 feet. Winds gusting as high as 75 mph. * WHERE...Southern Mountains. * WHEN...From 11 PM this evening to 11 PM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Winter driving conditions are expected. Traction laws may be enacted. Areas of blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility impacting routes such as SR-143 to Brian Head. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Strong winds may continue through around 5 AM, with wind gusts to 75 mph possible. This will cause very low visibility in areas of wind-driven heavy snowfall and blowing snow.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For graphical depictions of the snowfall forecast, including Official NWS Forecast, High End Amount, and Low End Amount, visit weather.gov/slc/winter. For winter road conditions from the Utah Department of Transportation, visit http://www.udottraffic.utah.gov/roadweatherforecast.aspx.
